prompt: <description>Part 1 Creating the first part The first part is a long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. 1. Set the Euler angles to `[-90.0, 0.0, -90.0]` degrees. 2. Set the translation vector to `[0.0, 0.0, 0.0]`. Next, create the 2D sketch. 1. Create a new face and create a loop on it. 2. Draw a small circle on this loop using the following parameters: - Center: `[0.0056, 0.0056]` - Radius: `0.0056` 3. Draw another circle on the same loop. Its parameters are: - Center: `[0.0056, 0.0056]` - Radius: `0.0045` 4. Ensure the loop is closed. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters. 1. Set the sketch scale to `0.0112`. 2. Extrude the sketch to create the 3D model. Use these parameters for extrusion: - Depth towards normal: `0.75` - Depth opposite normal: `0.0` Part 2 Creating the second part The second part is a CAD model of a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a cylindrical tube. The tube has a smaller diameter than the cylinders. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. 1. Set the Euler angles to `[0.0, 0.0, 0.0]` degrees. 2. Set the translation vector to `[0.1472, 0.0028, 0.0056]`. Next, create the 2D sketch. 1. Create four new faces, each with a loop on it. 2. Draw a circle on each loop using the following parameters: - Faces 1 and 2: - Center: `[0.0028, 0.0028]` - Radius: `0.0028` - Face 3: - Center: `[0.1528, 0.0028]` - Radius: `0.0028` - Face 4: - Center: `[0.3028, 0.0028]` - Radius: `0.0028` 3. Ensure all loops are closed. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters. 1. Set the sketch scale to `0.4556`. 2. Cut the sketch to create the 3D model. Use these parameters for CutFeatureOperation: - Depth towards normal: `0.0112` - Depth opposite normal: `0.0`</description>
